fields.definition: An aroma is a scent or smell.
fields.example: I love the aroma of coffee in the morning.

fields.definition: A beverage is a drink.
fields.example: The waiter brought our beverages first. Then he brought our food.

fields.definition: A cluster of things is a small group of them placed close together.
fields.example: She held a large cluster of grapes in her hand.

fields.definition: To combine is to join together to make a single thing or group.
fields.example: Mina combined peanut butter and jelly to make a sandwich.

fields.definition: When a liquid is condensed, it is made thicker.
fields.example: One way to make a dessert thick and sweet is to use condensed milk.

fields.definition: When something is contemporary, it is related to the present time.
fields.example: Contemporary scientists have learned quite a bit about DNA.

fields.definition: To cultivate plants is to care for them and help them grow.
fields.example: A research company is cultivating new kinds of rice to aid poor countries.

fields.definition: When something is divine, it is related to gods.
fields.example: Legends say that music was given to men as a divine gift from the gods.

fields.definition: When it is humid, there is a lot of water in the air.
fields.example: It is very humid inside of a sauna.

fields.definition: An odor is a very distinct smell.
fields.example: He knew there was a leak when he noticed the strong odor of natural gas.

fields.definition: The palate is the top part of the mouth.
fields.example: You can touch your palate with your tongue.

fields.definition: Paradise is the place or condition of happiness where things are perfect.
fields.example: My vacation in Hawaii was like being in paradise.

fields.definition: A plantation is a big farm that only grows certain kinds of crops.
fields.example: In the 1800s, there were many cotton plantations in the southern US.

fields.definition: When something is rapid, it moves or changes very quickly.
fields.example: His mother was surprised by her son’s rapid growth.

fields.definition: A rate is the speed at which something happens.
fields.example: Grass tends to grow at a very slow rate.

fields.definition: When something is soothing, it makes you calm or relaxed.
fields.example: The soothing music helped the baby fall asleep.

fields.definition: When something is subtle, it is not easy to see or notice.
fields.example: The handsome man has a subtle smile.

fields.definition: The texture of something is the way its surface looks and feels.
fields.example: The texture of a rock found in the water is typically very smooth.

fields.definition: When something is toxic, it is poisonous. Toxic things are very dangerous.
fields.example: Please check the label to see if the product is toxic.

fields.definition: To vary means to be different from another thing in size or amount.
fields.example: The heights of the people in my class vary by a large amount.

fields.definition: An accident is an unexpected undesirable event.
fields.example: She had to go to the hospital after she was in a serious car accident.

fields.definition: An admiral is someone who controls many military ships.
fields.example: They won the sea battle because of the admiral’s great leadership.

fields.definition: An arc is a curved shape.
fields.example: A rainbow has the shape of an arc.

fields.definition: Your character is your personality.
fields.example: My sister’s character is fun and very outgoing.

fields.definition: Your conscience is your inner sense of what is right and wrong.
fields.example: I recycle everything I can, so my conscience is clear!

fields.definition: If something is fiery, it is burning strongly.
fields.example: The fiery blaze burned all night long.

fields.definition: Flesh is the skin, muscle and fat on your body.
fields.example: The zebra’s flesh has black and white stripes.

fields.definition: A grapefruit is a fruit similar to an orange, but bigger and not as sweet.
fields.example: Would you like a grapefruit with your breakfast?

fields.definition: Hay is dry grass used to feed animals or used as a covering.
fields.example: I need to buy some more hay for the horse to sleep on.

fields.definition: If you are horrified, you are very shocked and feel upset.
fields.example: I was horrified when I read about the old lady who was attacked.

fields.definition: Kerosene is a type of oil. It is used in some lamps and stoves.
fields.example: Many people in poor countries cook on kerosene stoves.

fields.definition: A loop is a line made into the shape of a circle.
fields.example: He made a loop with the rope and placed it over the post.

fields.definition: A paddle is a piece of wood or plastic that moves a boat across water.
fields.example: We need a paddle to help us move across the water.

fields.definition: A raft is a floating platform made from pieces of wood tied together.
fields.example: The man made a raft out of bamboo and floated out to sea.

fields.definition: When something is sour, it has a sharp and unpleasant taste.
fields.example: I don’t like lemons because I think they are too sour.

fields.definition: A stake is a small, sharp piece of wood or metal that is put into the ground.
fields.example: We marked our property by placing stakes into the ground.

fields.definition: A steward is a person like a waiter who serves food on planes and ships.
fields.example: The steward is bringing some tea.

fields.definition: String is a thin piece of fabric or rope.
fields.example: I found a large ball of string.

fields.definition: A thorn is a sharp part of a plant.
fields.example: Be careful of the thorns when you pick the roses!

fields.definition: To wreck something means to destroy or ruin it.
fields.example: The teenagers wrecked the house for no reason at all.

fields.definition: To admonish someone is to tell them you disapprove of their behavior.
fields.example: The teacher admonished Mark because he was chewing gum in class.

fields.definition: If something is audible, then it is able to be heard.
fields.example: The sound of the drums was audible from miles away.

fields.definition: If something or someone is awesome, they are impressive or frightening.
fields.example: The huge military plane was an awesome sight.

fields.definition: To beware means to be careful of something or someone that is dangerous.
fields.example: You should beware of driving fast on wet roads.

fields.definition: To brag means to talk of one’s abilities or achievements in a proud way.
fields.example: He had strong muscles and bragged about it to the entire class.

fields.definition: If someone is conscious of something, then they are aware of it.
fields.example: The new student was conscious of the other students staring at her.

fields.definition: To disagree with someone means to have a different opinion from them.
fields.example: The lawyers disagreed about the best way to settle the case.

fields.definition: To echo means that a sound repeats itself because it bounced off an object.
fields.example: The child yelled over the canyon, and the wall echoed the sound.

fields.definition: If something is eventual, it will happen at the end of a series of events.
fields.example: The constant training and planning led the team to an eventual victory.

fields.definition: A hint is information that suggests something will happen or is true.
fields.example: I quietly passed on a hint to my sister about the test.

fields.definition: An idiot is a person who is not smart or who has done something silly.
fields.example: Because he got lost in the forest, the man felt like an idiot.

fields.definition: If something is immense, it is very large.
fields.example: An immense amount of money was needed to buy such a large boat.

fields.definition: If something is indirect, then it is not the easiest or straightest way.
fields.example: He chose to take the most indirect route to the coast.

fields.definition: An option is a choice between two or more things.
fields.example: The children were given the option of three houses to pick from.

fields.definition: A pastime is an activity done for fun that you do often.
fields.example: In the US, baseball is considered the national pastime.

fields.definition: If something is perfect, then it is without any mistakes.
fields.example: She got all the questions right, so her score was perfect.

fields.definition: To pinpoint something means to locate it exactly.
fields.example: The navigation system in my car is able to pinpoint my exact location.

fields.definition: To switch means to change something to something else.
fields.example: Mom switched the TV station from the news to her favorite show.

fields.definition: If something or someone is thorough, then they are complete in every way.
fields.example: Tina did a thorough job of cleaning the stains out of the carpet.

fields.definition: To torment someone means to cause them to suffer on purpose.
fields.example: She tormented her little brother by taking his favorite toy.

fields.definition: A beak is the hard curved part of a bird’s mouth.
fields.example: The bird used her beak to dig a small hole in the ground.

fields.definition: If something is damp, it is somewhat wet.
fields.example: My hair is still damp from my shower.

fields.definition: To disapprove of something is to think that it is wrong.
fields.example: Alex, disapproved of his son’s behavior.

fields.definition: You use except to talk about the only thing that a statement does not apply to.
fields.example: Everyone had fun on the trip except Jim, who felt ill the whole time.

fields.definition: A flight is an act of flying, often in an airplane.
fields.example: The airplane made a flight around the world.

fields.definition: When someone is fond of something, they like it.
fields.example: I am very fond of chocolate cake.

fields.definition: When something or someone is immoral, they are evil or do bad things.
fields.example: Stealing money from one’s mother is an immoral act.

fields.definition: Ivy is a plant with long vines that grows upward typically on walls.
fields.example: The walls of the castle are covered with ivy.

fields.definition: To moan is to make a low sound when feeling pain or sadness.
fields.example: The sick man moaned from his bed.

fields.definition: If someone is oblivious of something, they are unaware of it.
fields.example: I was late to school because I was oblivious of the time.

fields.definition: To perish means to die, usually because of bad conditions or bad events.
fields.example: Many people perish in wars.

fields.definition: A pit is a big hole in the ground.
fields.example: Michael fell into the pit and needed some help to get out.

fields.definition: The rim is the outside edge of a round thing, like a cup or bottle.
fields.example: I put my lips to the rim of the bottle and took a drink.

fields.definition: A roost is a place where birds can land and rest or sleep.
fields.example: The family of doves made a roost at the top of the tree.

fields.definition: If something is slippery, it is wet or smooth and causes people to slip.
fields.example: The repairman fell down on the floor because it was too slippery.

fields.definition: To soar means to fly high in the air.
fields.example: As the sun rose, two eagles soared through the sky.

fields.definition: If something is trivial, it is not important or meaningful.
fields.example: Television is trivial, but learning to read is very important.

fields.definition: If something is typical, it is normal for a certain type of thing.
fields.example: Barking is typical behavior for dogs.

fields.definition: If something is utterly a way, it is completely that way.
fields.example: When the sun was blocked by the moon, it was utterly dark outside.

fields.definition: To weep means to cry.
fields.example: My sister told me the dramatic movie would make me weep.

fields.uz: juda uzoq muddat davomida; Vaqt oralig'i
fields.definition: If you do something awhile, you do it for a short time.
fields.example: Wait here awhile, and I’ll bring some tea.

fields.definition: Cyberspace is the imaginary place of the Internet where activities occur.
fields.example: I didn’t receive your email. It probably got lost in cyberspace.

fields.definition: To edit means to correct a piece of writing so that it is suitable to be published.
fields.example: She asked her brother to edit her paper before she submitted it to her teacher.

fields.definition: An essay is a short piece of writing on a certain subject.
fields.example: She had to write a two-page essay for her English class.

fields.definition: To evaluate something means to study it, so a decision can be made.
fields.example: Joe and Ken evaluated the plan and agreed that it would work.

fields.definition: To faint means to go unconscious and fall down.
fields.example: Carol fainted because she hadn’t eaten in over a day.

fields.definition: If something is global, it happens all around the world.
fields.example: Pollution is a global problem.

fields.definition: A gymnasium is a building with equipment that you can use to get exercise.
fields.example: When I go to the gymnasium, I use the treadmill for 20 minutes.

fields.definition: To highlight something means to mark it with a color so that it is easy to see.
fields.example: I read my vocabulary list and highlighted the most difficult words.

fields.definition: If someone is ignorant about something, they have no knowledge about it.
fields.example: I’m a bit ignorant about his theories. Can you explain them to me?

fields.definition: An index is a list of words at the end of a book that gives information.
fields.example: If you look in the index, you’ll find the right page number.

fields.definition: A lecture is a long, educational speech.
fields.example: His lecture on world hunger was very informative.

fields.definition: A moral is a message at the end of a story that teaches you something.
fields.example: At the end of the story, Mother explained the moral to the children.

fields.definition: To operate means to work or function.
fields.example: I’m sorry, but the trains are not operating today.

fields.definition: If something is private, it is only used by one person or group.
fields.example: Don’t look at my diary! It’s private!

fields.definition: When something is recent, it happened a short time ago.
fields.example: I did not know what caused his recent behavior.

fields.definition: A resolution is a personal decision.
fields.example: At New Year, I made a list of resolutions to help me have a better year.

fields.definition: A semester is a portion of a school year.
fields.example: Jack is in his second semester of college.

fields.definition: If something is typewritten, it is written on a computer or typewriter.
fields.example: This is an important, formal project and must be typewritten.

fields.definition: When something is weird, it is very strange.
fields.example: My best friend’s dad is a bit weird.

fields.definition: If something is absolute, it is total or complete.
fields.example: My presentation was an absolute disaster! It was terrible!

fields.definition: Alas is a word that people say when something bad happens.
fields.example: I looked everywhere for my purse, but alas, I couldn’t find it.

fields.definition: If you are attentive, you are careful and you pay attention.
fields.example: He is a good student because he is attentive to every detail on his work.

fields.definition: A cape is a large cloth that covers one’s back and is tied around the neck.
fields.example: The superhero wore a long red cape.

fields.definition: To envision something means to imagine that it may happen.
fields.example: I can envision my mom’s face when I give her this present!

fields.definition: When something happens evenly, it happens at the same rate or level.
fields.example: The food was handed out evenly among the hungry people.

fields.definition: Folk are common or average people.
fields.example: I’ve invited all the folks from our street to a gathering at my place.

fields.definition: To melt means to turn from a solid to a liquid.
fields.example: The snowman that we made yesterday melted in the sun.

fields.definition: A patch is a part of a surface that is different in appearance from the rest.
fields.example: There was one small patch of grass in the sand-covered desert.

fields.definition: Pleasure is a feeling of happiness.
fields.example: The student smiled with pleasure when she received the prize.

fields.definition: A pop is a short, loud sound.
fields.example: I heard a loud pop; then my computer screen shattered.

fields.definition: A pudding is a sweet dessert.
fields.example: Would you like some chocolate pudding and coffee for dessert?

fields.definition: A rail is a horizontal bar made of metal or wood.
fields.example: The cat was sitting on the rail of the fence.

fields.definition: A recipe is a set of instructions to make food.
fields.example: The apple cake that you made is really tasty. Can I have the recipe, please?

fields.definition: A role is the normal purpose or function of a person or thing.
fields.example: My role at work is to check the quality of the products.

fields.definition: To shrink means to get smaller.
fields.example: If you stick to a healthy diet, your stomach will shrink!

fields.definition: To soak something means to make it very wet.
fields.example: You need to soak these beans overnight before you cook them.

fields.definition: A spark is a small, quick flash of fire.
fields.example: As he welded the two pieces of metal together, sparks flew everywhere.

fields.definition: A spirit is someone’s feelings and personality, but not a physical body part.
fields.example: He has a very outgoing spirit. He can make friends with anyone.

fields.definition: A suit is a set of clothes. It usually includes a jacket with pants or a skirt.
fields.example: I wore my new suit on my date with Melissa.

fields.definition: An account with a bank is an arrangement to keep one’s money there.
fields.example: After I paid for the new car, my bank account was nearly empty.

fields.definition: An architect is a person who designs buildings.
fields.example: The plans for building the new home were drawn by a famous architect.

fields.definition: To conceal something means to hide it.
fields.example: You should conceal your money so no one can take it from you.

fields.definition: A crime is something bad that a person does that can be punished by law.
fields.example: Police quickly arrived at the scene of the crime.

fields.definition: A deed is a certificate that proves that someone owns something.
fields.example: When she bought the car, she was given a deed to show the car was hers.

fields.definition: Gratitude is a feeling of being thankful.
fields.example: The kids showed Aunt Tess much gratitude for visiting them.

fields.definition: A habitat is the natural home of animals or plants.
fields.example: Frogs are often found in a wet habitat, such as near a lake, river, or pond.

fields.definition: To intervene means to help stop a problem between two people or groups.
fields.example: The students argued until the teacher intervened.

fields.definition: A landmark is an object that helps people find or remember a location.
fields.example: The tall tree was used as a landmark for people to find the road to the inn.

fields.definition: If something is legal, it is related to the law or allowed by the law.
fields.example: It was not legal for him to drive until he was eighteen years old.

fields.definition: If something is memorable, then it is remembered for a special reason.
fields.example: The party was memorable; people were still talking about it years later.

fields.definition: To oblige someone means to require them to do something.
fields.example: If I wanted to have playtime, I was obliged to clean my room once a week.

fields.definition: An offense is an action that breaks the law and requires punishment.
fields.example: He was put in jail for two days for the offense.

fields.definition: To proclaim something means to say it in public.
fields.example: The army general proclaimed that the war was won.

fields.definition: A rally is a large public meeting in order to support something.
fields.example: The school had a rally in the gym to support the basketball team.

fields.definition: To resolve something means to find a solution.
fields.example: She resolved the problem with her children by giving them both a toy.

fields.definition: Resources are a person or country’s money and materials that they can use.
fields.example: The poor man didn’t have the resources to feed himself.

fields.definition: A sentence is punishment given to someone who didn’t follow the law.
fields.example: The sentence for stealing a car is much worse than for stealing candy.

fields.definition: To volunteer means to offer to do something for free.
fields.example: Many people volunteered to help the adults learn to read.

fields.definition: A witness is someone who sees or hears a crime or accident happen.
fields.example: The woman was the only witness of the horrible crime.

fields.definition: Access is the right to enter or use something.
fields.example: The manager was the only person with access to the password.

fields.definition: Conduct is the way that someone acts.
fields.example: She was punished for her bad conduct.

fields.definition: When an event or action is constant, it happens a lot or all the time.
fields.example: The television at home is in constant use.

fields.definition: A crack is a narrow space between the parts of something broken.
fields.example: The old window was covered with cracks.

fields.definition: A device is an object or a machine.
fields.example: A thermometer is a device that tells temperature.

fields.definition: To enclose something is to contain it.
fields.example: The cows in the field were enclosed by a fence.

fields.definition: To grip something is to hold it very tightly.
fields.example: I was scared, so I gripped my older sister’s hand.

fields.definition: To halt is to stop moving.
fields.example: The criminal halted when he saw the police coming.

fields.definition: If something is impending, it is going to happen soon.
fields.example: The student was nervous about his impending test.

fields.definition: To influence someone or something is to have an effect over them.
fields.example: My friend influenced my decision to attend Terrance University.

fields.definition: A law is a rule made by the legislative body.
fields.example: The students learned about different laws during social studies class.

fields.definition: A mode is a setting or condition on a machine.
fields.example: Mother turned the TV to quiet mode while she talked on the phone.

fields.definition: To perspire means to sweat.
fields.example: I usually perspire a lot when I am at practice.

fields.definition: To replace something is to put it in the place of something else.
fields.example: I replaced the tire on my car because it was flat.

fields.definition: To snap something means to break it suddenly, which causes a loud noise.
fields.example: I took the stick and snapped it with my hands.

fields.definition: If a person or animal is sly, they are sneaky or good at tricking people.
fields.example: The sly fox stole the eggs from the nest.

fields.definition: To tend to do something is to be likely to do it or to do it often.
fields.example: My mom tends to buy me the perfect gift each Christmas.

fields.definition: When something is valid, it is correct or based on good reasoning.
fields.example: The expert’s opinion on the subject was more valid than others.

fields.definition: A version is an account of something that differs slightly from the original.
fields.example: She read the students British version of the Chinese fairy tale.

fields.definition: You use whatsoever after a noun to emphasize that there is nothing of that thing.
fields.example: The boy had no idea whatsoever how to solve the story problem.

fields.definition: If something is alongside another thing, then it is next to it.
fields.example: We work alongside each other in the office.

fields.definition: Your appetite is your hunger for food.
fields.example: Tom has a big appetite. He eats all the time.

fields.definition: To assist someone is to help them.
fields.example: Andrew assisted me with my homework.

fields.definition: A breeze is a soft wind.
fields.example: The breeze caused the leaves to fall off the tree.

fields.definition: To defy someone is to work against them or refuse to do what they say.
fields.example: The students got into trouble for defying their teacher’s rules.

fields.definition: To display something is to show it, especially by putting it in a certain place.
fields.example: The museum displayed many wonderful paintings.

fields.definition: If something or someone is efficient, they do not waste energy.
fields.example: My car is very efficient. I rarely have to buy gas.

fields.definition: If someone is feeble, they are small or weak.
fields.example: The boy was too feeble to carry the object very far.

fields.definition: To forgive someone is to stop being angry with them.
fields.example: Sandra forgave Peter after he said he was sorry.

fields.definition: If someone is lively, they have a lot of energy.
fields.example: Jennifer is very lively: she’s always running and playing.

fields.definition: If something is majestic, it is large and beautiful.
fields.example: The rich people lived in a big, majestic house.

fields.definition: You use nor to connect two negative ideas.
fields.example: I eat neither apples nor oranges. I don’t like either one.

fields.definition: If someone is outraged, they are very angry.
fields.example: My father was outraged when he saw that I had crashed his car.

fields.definition: If someone is pessimistic, they believe that the worst will happen.
fields.example: John is pessimistic. He always thinks something bad will happen.

fields.definition: A rumor is something people talk about even though it may not be true.
fields.example: Kevin was spreading rumors about Marcia to everyone.

fields.definition: To slap someone means to hit them with the palm of the hand.
fields.example: Out of anger, Helen slapped Eunice on the face.

fields.definition: To smash something is to break it into many small pieces.
fields.example: Jacob smashed the window with a rock.

fields.definition: A subject is the topic that is being discussed or taught.
fields.example: The subject of Marco’s speech was the economy.

fields.definition: A wage is the money that a person gets for doing a job.
fields.example: The wages I receive from my job are really great!

fields.definition: You use whereas to show how two things are different.
fields.example: My sister loves horror movies, whereas I prefer comedies.

fields.definition: When something is animate, it has life.
fields.example: Rocks and machines are not animate things.

fields.definition: To classify things is to put them into groups based on their type.
fields.example: The biologist classified the plant as a completely new species.

fields.definition: To concede is to admit that something is true against your wish.
fields.example: The student conceded that he had cheated on the test.

fields.definition: A concept is an idea about something.
fields.example: I learned some concepts of molecules before working in the science lab.

fields.definition: To construct something means to make or build it.
fields.example: The men used wood and metal to construct a house.

fields.definition: A decade is a period often years.
fields.example: She celebrated her three decades of work with the company.

fields.definition: A diagram is a simple drawing that explains what something is or how it works.
fields.example: By following the diagram, I was able to put the desk together.

fields.definition: A ferry is a boat that carries passengers over short distances.
fields.example: The ferry took the people across the lake.

fields.definition: If something is handy, it is useful.
fields.example: An eraser is handy if you make a lot of mistakes.

fields.definition: To isolate is to separate one person or thing from a group.
fields.example: The teacher isolated the bad child from the class before talking with her.

fields.definition: A longing is a strong feeling of wanting.
fields.example: Since he skipped breakfast, he had a longing for food all morning.

fields.definition: If something is numerous, there are many of those things.
fields.example: It was hard to drive fast since there were numerous holes in the road.

fields.definition: A particle is a very small piece of something.
fields.example: The bottles of wine were covered in a layer of dust particles.

fields.definition: A plea is a request that is urgent or emotional.
fields.example: The poor, hungry man made a plea for food.

fields.definition: To refrain from something is to avoid doing it.
fields.example: The doctor asked Mary to refrain from eating fast food as part of her diet.

fields.definition: A review of something is a formal inspection of it by people in authority.
fields.example: The government ordered a careful review of the economic situation.

fields.definition: If someone is sophisticated, they know many things about the world.
fields.example: Jake is one of the most sophisticated persons I’ve ever met.

fields.definition: To surrender something is to give it up.
fields.example: The thief surrendered the money to the police when he was caught.

fields.definition: If something is upright, it is standing up straight.
fields.example: Meerkats can’t walk like humans, but they can stand upright.

fields.definition: If something is worthwhile, it is important or useful.
fields.example: On his visit to Canada, he realized studying English was worthwhile.

fields.definition: An alliance is a group of people who work together.
fields.example: The junior executives formed an alliance with each other.

fields.definition: Applause is the noise made when people clap hands to show approval.
fields.example: At the end of his speech, everyone gave applause.

fields.definition: If you are armed, you are carrying a weapon.
fields.example: The robber was armed with a gun.

fields.definition: If something is authoritative, it uses the best information available.
fields.example: This book is an authoritative source on Ancient Egypt’s Queen Nefertiti.

fields.definition: A ceremony is an event that happens on special occasions.
fields.example: Tom and Amy’s marriage ceremony is in June.

fields.definition: Culture is the music, art, and writings of a certain place or group of people.
fields.example: Ancient Mexican culture is renowned for its architecture.

fields.definition: A defense is something that is done to protect another thing.
fields.example: The airforce works in defense of its country.

fields.definition: A detail is a small piece of information.
fields.example: Jane told Ben all the details of her trip to China.

fields.definition: When a group of things is diverse, it is made up of a wide variety of things.
fields.example: Big cities have diverse populations with people of different races and ages.

fields.definition: To enchant someone is to make them feel very interested or happy.
fields.example: The beautiful woman enchanted everybody in the room.

fields.definition: To equip someone is to give them the things needed to do something.
fields.example: Steve was equipped with the tools needed to do the job.

fields.definition: An exception is someone or something not conforming to a rule.
fields.example: Most students thought the test was hard, but Tim was the exception.

fields.definition: A genre is a type of literature, art, or music characterized by its style.
fields.example: She is considered a master in the comedy genre.

fields.definition: An impact is the effect someone or something has on another.
fields.example: My grandmother had a great impact on my life.

fields.definition: To lure someone is to convince them to do something, by using a trick.
fields.example: The store lures people in with big signs that say “Sale!”

fields.definition: An obstacle is an object or a problem that stops you from doing something.
fields.example: Climbing over the giant rock was the biggest obstacle for the hikers.

fields.definition: A shelter is a place to go that is safe from danger or bad weather.
fields.example: The frog took shelter from the storm in a nearby cave.

fields.definition: To sort means to separate things into different groups or classes.
fields.example: He sorted his clothes by colors and sizes.

fields.definition: To supply something means to give people what they need or want.
fields.example: The water heater supplied the house with warm water.

fields.definition: If people are vain, they are only concerned with how they look.
fields.example: Rebecca is so vain that she looks at herself in every mirror.

fields.definition: An alternative is something that you can choose instead of your first choice.
fields.example: Her first plan to make extra money seemed weak, so she chose an alternative.

fields.definition: An avenue is a road, often a large one with buildings on each side.
fields.example: Drive down this avenue and then turn left to go to the park.

fields.definition: The belly is the stomach of a person or animal.
fields.example: His belly was full because he ate a lot of food.

fields.definition: A bid to do something is an attempt to do it.
fields.example: He made a bid to become the university’s next president.

fields.definition: To blow means to move air or move something through the air, as in the wind.
fields.example: The wind is blowing very hard today. We should stay inside.

fields.definition: A conflict is a fight between different people or groups.
fields.example: The two nations had a conflict over which one could use the water in the river.

fields.definition: A continent is one of the seven large areas of land on the Earth.
fields.example: Asia is the largest continent.

fields.definition: A current is a steady and constant flow of air or water in a river or ocean.
fields.example: The ocean currents took the ship far off into the sea.

fields.definition: Disrespect is rudeness or a behavior that shows a lack of respect.
fields.example: He showed disrespect by arguing with his boss during a meeting.

fields.definition: Enthusiasm is a very strong good feeling about something.
fields.example: The crowd showed their enthusiasm for the soccer team by cheering loudly.

fields.definition: When something is harsh, it is very unpleasant.
fields.example: The desert can be a very harsh environment.

fields.definition: To lean is to bend the body in a particular direction.
fields.example: The woman leaned against the counter because she was tired.

fields.definition: The meantime is the time between two events.
fields.example: Ted began setting the table. In the meantime, I began preparing the food.

fields.definition: Mischief is behavior that is meant to trick or cause trouble for people.
fields.example: Ben was up to mischief when he persuaded Ken to paint his face.

fields.definition: Muscle is a mass of tissue attached to bone that helps you move.
fields.example: She went to the gym in order to make her muscles stronger.

fields.definition: To rescue someone means to remove them from danger.
fields.example: The firefighter rescued the man from the burning building.

fields.definition: A succession is a number of things that follow one after the other.
fields.example: The student said the letters of the alphabet in succession.

fields.definition: The terrain is the land and all of its physical features or parts.
fields.example: The terrain below was rocky and full of hills.

fields.definition: If someone is timid, they are afraid, shy, or nervous.
fields.example: The timid child hides behind her mother whenever she sees a stranger.

fields.definition: Violence is forceful action that is meant to injure or kill people.
fields.example: The boy hit his brother in an act of violence.

fields.definition: To affect someone or something is to have an influence over them.
fields.example: The student’s poor attitude affected the other students in the class.

fields.definition: An autograph is the written name of a famous person.
fields.example: Everybody wanted the movie star’s autograph.

fields.definition: A bead is a drop of liquid.
fields.example: Beads of water collected outside the glass.

fields.definition: To brew coffee or tea means to pour hot water over it.
fields.example: Please brew a fresh pot of coffee.

fields.definition: To charm someone is to please them with your personality.
fields.example: Gail charmed everyone with her humorous stories.

fields.definition: A destiny is all the things that happen or will happen to a person in their life.
fields.example: It was his destiny to become a great singer.

fields.definition: A horn is a device that makes a loud noise.
fields.example: The boy honked his horn while he rode his bicycle past the house.

fields.definition: When someone is irritable, they become annoyed or angry very easily.
fields.example: She is irritable when she doesn’t get enough sleep.

fields.definition: To lag behind is to move slowly behind other moving objects.
fields.example: The girl on rollerblades lagged behind the little girl on the bicycle.

fields.definition: To maximize something means to make it the biggest in size or amount.
fields.example: Businesses try to maximize their profits.

fields.definition: A nightmare is a bad or scary dream.
fields.example: The girl was scared to go back to sleep because she had a nightmare.

fields.definition: When something is nutritious, it helps the body stay healthy.
fields.example: Mangoes are one of the most nutritious fruits in the world.

fields.definition: Protein is a substance that is necessary for the body to grow and be strong.
fields.example: Fish and beef are good sources of protein.

fields.definition: A signature is your name that you have written in your own way.
fields.example: I put my signature at the end of the letter.

fields.definition: Stuff is a word used to refer to things without mentioning the things by name.
fields.example: We gave a lot of stuff to the charity.

fields.definition: When something is subconscious, it is done without thinking about it.
fields.example: Breathing is one of the subconscious things that the body does.

fields.definition: A van is a vehicle that is used for carrying things but is smaller than a truck.
fields.example: The delivery company uses large vans to deliver packages.

fields.definition: To warn someone is to make them know of possible danger in the future.
fields.example: The lifeguard warned people to stay away from the rough ocean.

fields.definition: A workout is an exercise routine that helps improve health.
fields.example: She doesn’t do her workout on the weekends.

fields.definition: To zoom is to move quickly.
fields.example: The cars zoomed along the road.

fields.definition: A brick is a block of hard clay that is used for building things, such as walls.
fields.example: There were several bricks scattered on the ground.

fields.definition: To crumble means to break or fall apart into small pieces.
fields.example: The old house’s walls crumbled into a pile of rock and wood.

fields.definition: Dough is a mixture of flour and water that becomes bread when baked.
fields.example: I made heart-shaped cookies from the dough.

fields.definition: To express a feeling or idea means to show others how one thinks or feels.
fields.example: The nurse expressed her sympathy for the sick patient.

fields.definition: A fist is a hand with fingers bent in toward the palm.
fields.example: The bully made a fist and threatened to hit the small boy.

fields.definition: If something is flexible, then it can bend easily without breaking.
fields.example: The tree branch was so flexible it could be bent into a circle and not break.

fields.definition: To flush means the face becomes red due to heat, illness, or emotion.
fields.example: After the long race, the runner’s face was flushed.

fields.definition: To injure someone means to damage a part of their body.
fields.example: The car crash injured two people.

fields.definition: A lump is a small piece of something that is solid.
fields.example: The artist took a lump of clay and turned it into a beautiful pot.

fields.definition: A mixture is something that is made by mixing other things together.
fields.example: The walls were built using a mixture of water, rock, and dirt.

fields.definition: To reconcile means to return to a friendly relationship.
fields.example: After arguing, the two friends were reconciled with each other.

fields.definition: To ruin something means to harm or damage it greatly.
fields.example: Our walk in the park was ruined by the sudden rain.

fields.definition: To shatter something means to break it suddenly into many tiny pieces.
fields.example: When the ball hit the window, the glass shattered.

fields.definition: Shutters are wooden or metal covers in front of a window.
fields.example: Mr. Smith closed the shutters every night to make his bedroom dark.

fields.definition: To sift something means to remove all the large pieces.
fields.example: The baker sifted the flour into a large bowl.

fields.definition: If something is slight, then it is small or minor.
fields.example: There was only a slight change in the little boy’s height.

fields.definition: To sparkle means to shine brightly with quick flashes of light.
fields.example: The stars sparkled in the winter night’s sky.

fields.definition: To sprinkle means to scatter something all over something else.
fields.example: He sprinkled the pasta with salt and black pepper.

fields.definition: If food is stale, then it is not fresh but dry, hard, and not good to eat.
fields.example: The cookies sat on the table so long that they became stale.

fields.definition: To utter a word or a sound means to say it.
fields.example: The lost boy was so scared that he could barely utter a single word.

fields.definition: You use although to say that one thing is contrasted by another.
fields.example: Although she was late, her friends gave her a warm welcome.

fields.definition: To apply something means to put it on.
fields.example: She always applies makeup to her face before going outside.

fields.definition: To await something means to wait for it.
fields.example: The players awaited the judge’s decision.

fields.definition: When something is beloved, it is very special and you like it very much.
fields.example: The boy took a nap next to his beloved cat.

fields.definition: To bury someone or something means to put them in the ground.
fields.example: They buried their grandfather under his favorite tree after he died.

fields.definition: A climate is the usual weather in a place.
fields.example: The climate in the desert is very hot.

fields.definition: When you complain, you say that you are unhappy about something.
fields.example: The workers complained that they were being treated unfairly.

fields.definition: To confuse someone means to make them feel like they are unsure.
fields.example: The sign confused the traveler because it pointed in two directions.

fields.definition: When something is due, it is expected to happen or be done at that time.
fields.example: The papers were due on the 19th.

fields.definition: When you talk about an entire thing, you are talking about the whole thing.
fields.example: He was so hungry that he ate the entire pizza by himself.

fields.definition: To establish something means to create it.
fields.example: He wanted to establish a club for people to help the Earth.

fields.definition: A furnace is a place where heat is made.
fields.example: Mr. Jones came to fix the furnace.

fields.definition: A leash is a rope or chain that is used to lead an animal.
fields.example: A lot of dogs must wear a leash to keep them from running away.

fields.definition: To mature means to grow up to become an adult.
fields.example: When they matured, they became as tall as their parents.

fields.definition: To measure something means to find out the quality, value, or effect of it.
fields.example: The scientists carefully measured the amount of chemicals in the tubes.

fields.definition: The midst of something is the middle of it.
fields.example: She was in the midst of cleaning when the telephone rang.

fields.definition: Misery is extreme suffering.
fields.example: There was a lot of misery after Sam lost his dog.

fields.definition: When something happened prior to something else, it happened earlier.
fields.example: Ron had to wait since he arrived prior to the scheduled meeting time.

fields.definition: Research is close and careful study to discover new things.
fields.example: Scientists did a lot of research on the subject of blood type.

fields.definition: A variety of something is a group of many different kinds of it.
fields.example: There are a variety of flowers at the shop.

fields.definition: If something happens altogether, it happens completely.
fields.example: The company stopped using sugar altogether in its food.

fields.definition: To bind is to bring people together.
fields.example: The victims of the flood were bound by their need to help each other.

fields.definition: A bruise is a dark mark caused by being hit by something.
fields.example: She got a bruise on her knee from falling down.

fields.definition: A custom is a way of doing things that has been the same for a long time.
fields.example: It is a custom that the bride and groom have the first dance.

fields.definition: When someone is disobedient, they do not follow the rules or instructions.
fields.example: The disobedient children didn’t listen to their mother and had an accident.

fields.definition: To foresee something is to know about it before it happens.
fields.example: The teacher didn’t foresee any problems with her large class.

fields.definition: To glimpse something is to see it for a short time.
fields.example: She glimpsed outside the window as the plane was about to land.

fields.definition: A hoop is a ring that is made of plastic, metal, or wood.
fields.example: The boys tried to toss the ball through the basketball hoop.

fields.definition: Misfortune is bad luck or an unlucky event.
fields.example: His family helped him when he encountered misfortune.

fields.definition: When something is negative, it is unpleasant or sad.
fields.example: She doesn’t like to say negative things about her friends.

fields.definition: Per is used to mean “each” when giving a price, size, or amount.
fields.example: It costs $8 per person to watch the baseball game.

fields.definition: To plead is to ask for something you want very badly.
fields.example: He pleaded for his parents to let him go to the soccer game.

fields.definition: To rip something means to pull it apart.
fields.example: She ripped the paper in half by accident.

fields.definition: The sake of something is the reason for doing it.
fields.example: The parents worked hard for their children’s sake.

fields.definition: To scrape something is to rub it very hard with something sharp.
fields.example: I accidentally scraped the paint off the side of the car.

fields.definition: A source of something is the place that it comes from.
fields.example: The river was the source of drinking water for the village.

fields.definition: When somebody is stern, they are very serious.
fields.example: The stern teacher didn’t allow the students to speak during class.

fields.definition: To stitch is to use a needle and thread to join pieces of cloth together.
fields.example: My grandmother stitched the pieces together to make a big blanket.

fields.definition: A thump is the sound of a heavy object falling.
fields.example: They heard the thump when the bowling ball hit the floor.

fields.definition: When somebody is vehement, they are angry and emotional.
fields.example: Gina was vehement when she found out that Liz was bad in school.

fields.definition: A civilization is an organized group of humans that have culture and government.
fields.example: Most early civilizations in Central America didn’t use metal weapons.

fields.definition: When something is convenient, it is easy to do and does not take a lot of work.
fields.example: The bus is a convenient way to get to school.

fields.definition: A den is a living space for some types of animals, such as lions.
fields.example: The mother lion left her babies in the den.

fields.definition: Dew is the drops of water that form on the ground outside during the night.
fields.example: When we woke up, we saw that the grass was covered in dew.

fields.definition: When something is drastic, it is extreme or major.
fields.example: She made a drastic decision to get her long hair cut short.

fields.definition: To exit means to leave.
fields.example: The students exited through the front door.

fields.definition: A flock is a group of animals, such as birds, sheep or goats.
fields.example: There was one black sheep in the entire flock.

fields.definition: To fold is to bend something like paper or cloth so that it takes up less space.
fields.example: I folded the paper and put it in my pocket.

fields.definition: A lid is a top for a box or container that can be removed.
fields.example: He lifted the lid of the box and revealed her present.

fields.definition: To loom is to seem very large and often scary.
fields.example: The ominous clouds loomed over the school.

fields.definition: When something is mighty, it is strong and large.
fields.example: The mighty wrestler scared all who faced him.

fields.definition: A mushroom is a fungus with a round top. Some are used as food.
fields.example: The soup had fresh mushrooms in it.

fields.definition: When something is native, it is originating in a certain place or area.
fields.example: Avocadoes are native fruits of Mexico.

fields.definition: Poison is a dangerous substance that causes illness or death.
fields.example: They used poison to get rid of the rats in their home.

fields.definition: Reeds are tall and skinny plants that grow in groups near water.
fields.example: The sun set behind the reeds of the lake’s shore.

fields.definition: To shield something is to protect it.
fields.example: She shielded her eyes from the sun with sunglasses.

fields.definition: Stormy describes something affected or characterized by storms.
fields.example: The golfers decided to go home because of the stormy weather.

fields.definition: To sway is to move slowly from side to side.
fields.example: She swayed while she listened to the music.

fields.definition: When something is urban, it is related to the city.
fields.example: Subways are an important form of urban transportation.

fields.definition: To wade is to walk in or pass through water.
fields.example: The child waded in the water at the beach.

fields.definition: An accent is a certain way of speaking that shows where a person is from.
fields.example: The new teacher’s accent was clearly a German one.

fields.definition: A barber is a person whose job is to cut hair.
fields.example: My hair is getting much too long. I’d better go to the barber’s shop.

fields.definition: A basement of a house or building is a room that is built underground.
fields.example: They turned their basement into a game room.

fields.definition: When something is blank, it does not have anything on it.
fields.example: She got a blank paper to draw on.

fields.definition: To blink means to shut the eyes and quickly open them again.
fields.example: I blinked many times so that my eyes could adjust to the bright light.

fields.definition: A choir is a group of people who sing together.
fields.example: He had choir practice every day after school.

fields.definition: When something is comic, it is funny.
fields.example: The comic actor was famous for his jokes.

fields.definition: To complicate something means to make it harder than necessary.
fields.example: The bad weather complicated finishing the job quickly.

fields.definition: To decline an offer or invitation means to say no to it.
fields.example: She declined his offer to pay for her dinner.

fields.definition: An errand is a trip taken to do a specific activity.
fields.example: He couldn’t go to practice because he had several errands to do.

fields.definition: A glove is a piece of clothing that covers your fingers and hand.
fields.example: When it gets cold, I always put on a pair of gloves.

fields.definition: A hermit is one who lives alone and does not spend time with others.
fields.example: The hermit lived a simple life in a small cave in the forest.

fields.definition: If something is done justly, then it is fair.
fields.example: We justly decided to give the prize to him.

fields.definition: Leather is a material made from animal skin that is used to make clothing.
fields.example: He got a new leather jacket for his birthday.

fields.definition: To ponder something is to think about it carefully.
fields.example: She sat in the park and pondered her problem.

fields.definition: To reserve something means to keep it for a certain person or time.
fields.example: He reserved a table at the busy restaurant.

fields.definition: A script is the words of a film or play.
fields.example: He read the script of the play three times.

fields.definition: To search for something or someone means to look for them carefully.
fields.example: I searched the newspaper for a new job.

fields.definition: To slam is to close something hard.
fields.example: She slammed the book shut after she finished reading it.

fields.definition: A staircase is a set of stairs found inside a building.
fields.example: The staircase leads directly into the kitchen.

fields.definition: Afflicted means to suffer physically or mentally.
fields.example: He was afflicted by pain in his right arm.

fields.definition: An aisle is a space between two things that people use to walk.
fields.example: They were told to clear the aisle because the plane was about to land.

fields.definition: The atmosphere is the air around the Earth where weather conditions form.
fields.example: Scientists worry that harmful substances are hurting the atmosphere.

fields.definition: An author is a person who wrote a certain piece of writing.
fields.example: The author was hard at work on his next novel.

fields.definition: A breakdown is a failure to work correctly.
fields.example: Her car had a breakdown, and she wasn’t sure how to fix it.

fields.definition: Cargo is the items carried by a ship or airplane.
fields.example: The cargo of the ship got wet when it started raining.

fields.definition: A chapter is a part of a book that usually has a number or a title.
fields.example: The first chapter of a book usually introduces the main character of a story.

fields.definition: To connect two things means to join them together.
fields.example: I connected the mouse to my laptop computer.

fields.definition: Etc. is short for “etcetera.” It is used to refer to other unspecified objects.
fields.example: She was going to bring treats to the party: cookies, muffins, cake, etc.

fields.definition: To flip means to press a switch quickly to turn it on or off.
fields.example: To turn on the lights, just flip this switch.

fields.definition: If you are idle, you are not doing anything.
fields.example: She read a book to keep from being idle.

fields.definition: To notify someone of something is to tell them about it.
fields.example: The teacher notified us about a change to our assignment.

fields.definition: Peas are a vegetable that is small, round and green.
fields.example: His favorite food was peas.

fields.definition: A raisin is a dried grape.
fields.example: Raisins are one of my favorite snacks.

fields.definition: To retain something is to keep it.
fields.example: Even by the afternoon, the day had retained the morning’s freshness.

fields.definition: To state something means to say it in a definite way.
fields.example: The president stated his opinion about the world’s health concerns.

fields.definition: A tray is a flat plate used to hold food.
fields.example: The waiter brought our food on a tray.

fields.definition: If something is unfortunate, it is bad or unlucky.
fields.example: It was unfortunate that Dave’s team lost, but he still had fun.

fields.definition: When something is vivid, it is bright and colorful.
fields.example: The figures in the painting were vivid.

fields.definition: To vomit means to have food come up from one’s stomach.
fields.example: It is common for women to vomit when they are pregnant.

fields.definition: To betray someone means to treat them in a dishonest way.
fields.example: The man betrayed his country when he gave away national secrets.

fields.definition: A blast is a loud noise made by something that explodes.
fields.example: There was a loud blast when the police officer fired the gun.

fields.definition: A bracelet is a piece of jewelry that you wear around your wrist.
fields.example: My father gave me a pretty gold bracelet for my birthday.

fields.definition: To cease means to stop.
fields.example: After about an hour, the rain ceased, and a rainbow appeared.

fields.definition: To choke means to cough because you have difficulty breathing.
fields.example: There was a lot of smoke in the air, and it made me choke.

fields.definition: When an event is civil, it happens inside a country.
fields.example: The country was torn apart by a terrible civil war.

fields.definition: To comment means to say something that shows your personal opinion.
fields.example: Tom commented on the poor quality of the food.

fields.definition: To cross means to go from one side to the other side.
fields.example: We used his boat to cross to the other side of the lake.

fields.definition: A dent is damage caused by something heavy hitting something else.
fields.example: That blue car hit my car, and now there is a small dent in my car door.

fields.definition: To distrust someone means to believe that they are not honest.
fields.example: Don’t lend money to someone if you distrust them!

fields.definition: A fort is a small building that is specially built to defend an area from attack.
fields.example: When the army arrived, they built a big fort on the top of the hill.

fields.definition: To found means to bring something into existence.
fields.example: The pastor founded his church in the countryside.

fields.definition: Lining is a piece of cloth that covers the inside of clothes.
fields.example: This jacket is very warm because it has a thick lining.

fields.definition: A mass is a large number of things of one type.
fields.example: We received a mass of letters this morning.

fields.definition: To pray means to talk to God.
fields.example: When people go to church, they pray for their families and friends.

fields.definition: If a place is rife with something bad, it is very common in that place.
fields.example: This part of the country is rife with disease.

fields.definition: When something is the sole thing, it is the only thing of a particular type.
fields.example: His sole purpose in life was to help others.

fields.definition: If you sweep the floor, you clean it with a tool like a broom or a brush.
fields.example: There is a lot of dirt on the floor. Can you sweep it please?

fields.definition: Treachery is a behavior in which a person betrays a country or a person.
fields.example: The man ran away to escape from the treachery of his wife.

fields.definition: To tuck something means to put it somewhere so that it is neat or safe.
fields.example: He looked sloppy without his shirt being tucked into his pants.

fields.definition: A background is a person’s education, family, and experience.
fields.example: The new teacher had a background in science and math.

fields.definition: Bait is something used to trick a person or thing to do something.
fields.example: The best bait for catching fish is a big, fat worm.

fields.definition: To chronicle something means to record an event or speech.
fields.example: The daily newspaper chronicles local and world events.

fields.definition: Copper is a red-brown metal often used in electric wire and pipes.
fields.example: Ancient hunters melted copper to make knives and spears.

fields.definition: A disease is an illness that causes specific problems.
fields.example: He had a disease that caused him to lose his hearing.

fields.definition: Folklore is the collection of beliefs and stories of a culture.
fields.example: India’s folklore has stories written in long poems about great warriors.

fields.definition: To infect someone means to give them an illness.
fields.example: The common cold infects hundreds of millions of people each year.

fields.definition: To itch means to rub the skin with your fingernails.
fields.example: The rough fabric in his shirt made the back of his neck itch.

fields.definition: Literature is books, plays, and poetry.
fields.example: Early American literature covers the poetry and stories from 1500 to 1800.

fields.definition: A millennium is one thousand years.
fields.example: Stonehenge is believed to have been built about 5 millenniums ago.

fields.definition: A myth is a traditional story that explains a culture’s history and beliefs.
fields.example: In Greece, there was a myth about a woman who had snakes for hair.

fields.definition: To relate to something means to have a connection with it.
fields.example: A company’s plan usually relates to how much profit it can make.

fields.definition: A religion is a belief in a god or gods.
fields.example: Their religion taught that people should forgive their enemies.

fields.definition: A sum is a specific amount of money.
fields.example: He calculated the numbers to see what the sum of his bills would be.

fields.definition: A teller is a person who works with a bank’s customers.
fields.example: The teller at the bank helped Kelly put money into a savings account.

fields.definition: If someone is trustworthy, they are honest and truthful.
fields.example: Mary is one of the most trustworthy people I’ve ever met.

fields.definition: To update something means to make it more modern.
fields.example: We need to update the programs on our computers.

fields.definition: A vein is a tube in the body that carries blood toward the heart.
fields.example: The blue veins in my hand are just under my skin.

fields.definition: Venom is a poisonous substance that comes from animals or plants.
fields.example: A snake’s venom can be used to cure the illnesses it creates.

fields.definition: To promote someone means to raise them to a higher position or rank.
fields.example: After two years in the company, she was promoted to a manager.

fields.definition: Charity is an act of giving help, usually money, to those who need it.
fields.example: Thanks to his friends’ charity, he had enough money to pay the rent.

fields.definition: Commerce is the activity of buying and selling things.
fields.example: The new shopping mall increased the commerce in that section of town.

fields.definition: To condemn someone means to give them a specific punishment.
fields.example: The judge condemned the criminal to five years in prison.

fields.definition: If something is cozy, then it is comfortable, warm, and relaxing.
fields.example: The thick blanket made the bed very cozy.

fields.definition: To deplete an amount of something means to use up all of it.
fields.example: All the driving he was doing was depleting his car’s fuel supply.

fields.definition: An economy is the money and businesses of a country or region.
fields.example: The factory was good for the economy because it brought jobs to the area.

fields.definition: An empire is a large group of countries ruled by an emperor or empress.
fields.example: The emperor built roads to make travel easier throughout the empire.

fields.definition: Goods are anything that can be bought or sold.
fields.example: Shoes, hats, dresses and purses were the goods she wanted to buy.

fields.definition: To heed something means to obey or follow it.
fields.example: You should heed the advice on the sign and not drive so fast.

fields.definition: To hitchhike means to travel by asking for rides from passing vehicles.
fields.example: She didn’t have a car, so she hitchhiked several miles to her brother’s home.

fields.definition: To mock someone means to tease them in a cruel way.
fields.example: The girls mocked Nancy because she was a new student.

fields.definition: If someone is neutral, then they do not help either of the two fighting sides.
fields.example: The girl’s friend remained neutral while the couple was arguing.

fields.definition: To persecute means to treat someone badly.
fields.example: Dan felt persecuted because he was smaller than the other boys at school.

fields.definition: Pity is the feeling of sadness and kindness for those who are suffering.
fields.example: Because she had pity for the lost boy, she helped him find his parents.

fields.definition: To reduce something means to make it less in size or number.
fields.example: When the store reduced its prices, people wanted to shop there.

fields.definition: A scribe was a person whose job was to copy written works.
fields.example: In Ancient Egypt, scribes recorded important events.

fields.definition: A temper is someone’s mood or a chance that they might get angry.
fields.example: She has a temper. Even the slightest mistakes make her angry.

fields.definition: A throne is the special chair in which a ruler sits.
fields.example: Nobody except the king and queen sat in the thrones in the great hall.

fields.definition: Unity is the state of people working together for a certain purpose.
fields.example: The project was finished early, thanks to the unity of the workers.

fields.definition: A victor is a group or person that wins in a contest.
fields.example: At the end of the game, the blue team was the victor.

fields.definition: If something is accurate, it is completely correct.
fields.example: The story in the newspaper wasn’t very accurate.

fields.definition: To analyze something is to study it.
fields.example: The scientist will analyze the blood sample.

fields.definition: An asteroid is a giant rock from outer space.
fields.example: In 1908, a giant asteroid hit Siberia.

fields.definition: A controversy is a dispute about something that affects many people.
fields.example: There has been a lot of controversy over the judge’s decision.

fields.definition: To evolve is to change over time.
fields.example: Many people think that humans evolved from animals.

fields.definition: A factor is something that has an effect on the way another thing happens.
fields.example: Smoking is the main factor that causes lung cancer.

fields.definition: If something is genetic, it is related to the genes in one’s body.
fields.example: The color of one’s eyes is genetic.

fields.definition: A genome is the collection of all the genes in a living thing.
fields.example: Understanding the human genome may help cure many diseases.

fields.definition: To be identical is to be the same as someone or something else.
fields.example: James and John are identical twins.

fields.definition: An intellectual is a very smart person.
fields.example: We’ve always considered my Uncle Max the intellectual of the family.

fields.definition: A majority of something is almost all of the people or things in that group.
fields.example: A majority of the people voted for Tom Smith in the election.

fields.definition: A mammal is an animal that usually has hair and is not born from an egg.
fields.example: Even though it lives in the water, whales are actually mammals.

fields.definition: To multiply is to increase in number.
fields.example: In the past year, the number of people at work multiplied by ten percent.

fields.definition: Offspring are the children of a person or the babies of an animal.
fields.example: The dog’s offspring had the same color of fur as she did.

fields.definition: A pesticide is a substance used to kill insects.
fields.example: The farmer sprayed his crops with a pesticide to keep bugs away.

fields.definition: To regulate something is to control how it happens.
fields.example: The bank regulates how much money people can borrow from it.

fields.definition: To reinforce something is to make it stronger.
fields.example: Peter reinforced his opinion with information from a book.

fields.definition: If one is stricken by a disease or problem, they are badly affected by it.
fields.example: Mike was stricken with a horrible illness.

fields.definition: If something is vast, it is very large.
fields.example: The wealthy man bought a vast amount of land in the countryside.

fields.definition: A vegetarian is someone who does not eat any meat products.
fields.example: I became a vegetarian because I don’t like the taste of meat.

fields.definition: To cherish something means to hold it as very important.
fields.example: I cherish this trophy I won.

fields.definition: Compassion is a feeling of understanding for someone who is hurt or suffering.
fields.example: The veterinarian had compassion for the sick little puppy.

fields.definition: Consent is permission to do something.
fields.example: Their mother gave the children consent to go outside and play.

fields.definition: The core is the center of something.
fields.example: The rings of a tree start forming at its core.

fields.definition: If someone is cunning, they are good at tricking people.
fields.example: The cunning child fooled his parents into thinking that he was kind.

fields.definition: If someone is dizzy, then they feel off balance as if they will fall down.
fields.example: The pregnant woman was dizzy after standing up too quickly.

fields.definition: Equilibrium is the balance between different forces.
fields.example: The sudden drop in prices upset the equilibrium of the economy.

fields.definition: To foster a feeling or a skill means to help it develop.
fields.example: She helped foster a sense of calm in the little boy.

fields.definition: To grind something means to break it into very small pieces or powder.
fields.example: She wanted to grind the beans, so she could brew some coffee.

fields.definition: To growl means to make a deep, angry sound.
fields.example: The dog started to growl at the man walking by.

fields.definition: Moderation is a state of being just enough but not too much.
fields.example: It is important to eat in moderation so that you can have a healthy body.

fields.definition: A predator is an animal that kills and eats other animals.
fields.example: The peregrine falcon is a predator that eats fish.

fields.definition: If someone is sane, they can think in a normal way.
fields.example: Oliver does not act like a sane person when he is angry.

fields.definition: A saucer is a small round dish that you set a cup on.
fields.example: He placed the spoon on the saucer.

fields.definition: To snatch something means to take it away with a quick motion.
fields.example: He was so hungry that he snatched an apple from a tree.

fields.definition: To stagger means to move in an unsteady way and almost fall over.
fields.example: He staggered around after having too much to drink.

fields.definition: To stumble means to put your foot down wrong so that you almost fall.
fields.example: He stumbled as he ran through the puddle.

fields.definition: If someone is tense, they are worried something bad might happen.
fields.example: After the phone call, Monica was very tense.

fields.definition: To tumble means to fall, often in a rolling way.
fields.example: He lost his balance while snowboarding and tumbled to the ground.

fields.definition: To withhold something is to not give it to someone.
fields.example: They withheld all information until she paid her fine.

fields.definition: An aircraft is a vehicle that flies in the sky, such as an airplane or helicopter.
fields.example: At the museum in the airport, you can see a lot of old aircraft.

fields.definition: A celebrity is someone who is famous.
fields.example: It was the highlight of the evening when the celebrities arrived.

fields.definition: Concrete is a substance made from stones.
fields.example: The man covered the ground with concrete.

fields.definition: If someone is decisive, they make decisions quickly.
fields.example: Our boss is very decisive, so it did not take long to organize the project.

fields.definition: If someone is esteemed, many people like or respect them.
fields.example: An esteemed scientist is coming to the university to talk about her discoveries.

fields.definition: If something is ethical, it is the right thing to do.
fields.example: Many people believe that it is ethical to help others in need.

fields.definition: If plants or animals are extinct, there are none left.
fields.example: There used to be dinosaurs all over the world, but now they are extinct.

fields.definition: If a person or plant is hardy, it is strong and can live though difficult conditions.
fields.example: The farmer is a hardy man and doesn’t mind working outside.

fields.definition: An institute is an organization that is interested in research or teaching.
fields.example: I am going to a lecture about ancient Rome at the Historical Institute.

fields.definition: Jealousy is a feeling of wanting something that somebody else has.
fields.example: She felt a lot of jealousy when she saw Luke with two girls.

fields.definition: To migrate means to move from one place to another.
fields.example: Many birds migrate to warmer countries in the winter.

fields.definition: To nurture something means to care for it as it grows or develops.
fields.example: Robert nurtured his plants, and that is why they grow so well.

fields.definition: If something is overhead, it is located above you.
fields.example: As we sat on top of the hill, a plane flew overhead.

fields.definition: A principle is a belief about the correct way to behave.
fields.example: To maintain principles, it’s vital to watch, listen, and speak carefully.

fields.definition: If a place is rural, it is in the countryside instead of the city.
fields.example: I want to live in a small house in a rural area.

fields.definition: If a place is secluded, it is far away from any other place.
fields.example: There was a secluded bench in the park.

fields.definition: A species is a type of plant or animal.
fields.example: There are 21 different species of butterfly in this forest.

fields.definition: A swamp is a very wet area of land.
fields.example: There are lots of wild animals living in the swamp.

fields.definition: To traverse means to move or travel through an area.
fields.example: The explorer traversed the desert alone on a camel.

fields.definition: Zoology is a subject in which people study animals.
fields.example: Helen wants to study zoology because she has always liked animals.

fields.definition: An assumption is something that you believe is true but cannot prove.
fields.example: I went to the cafeteria on the assumption that everyone would be there.

fields.definition: Barley is a grain that is used for animal feed, health food and beer.
fields.example: The farmer grew barley to feed his cows in the winter.

fields.definition: A beast is a large, dangerous animal.
fields.example: A lion is one of the fiercest beasts on Earth.

fields.definition: A colonel is a military officer.
fields.example: James has been given a promotion in the army. He is now a colonel.

fields.definition: If a disease is contagious, it is easily carried from one person to another.
fields.example: You must wear protective clothing because the patient’s illness is contagious.

fields.definition: A corpse is a dead body of a human.
fields.example: After the accident, the corpse was taken to the hospital.

fields.definition: A crisis is a situation that is extremely stressful or dangerous.
fields.example: The airport workers’ strike led to a crisis at the airport.

fields.definition: To cure means to cause an illness or injury to end or disappear.
fields.example: My dentist cured me of my toothache.

fields.definition: If something is deformed, it is not shaped normally and may appear ugly.
fields.example: Even though the carrot was deformed, it was still safe to eat.

fields.definition: To discriminate means to judge people according to their looks.
fields.example: They discriminated against her because she was different.

fields.definition: An embassy is where government officials work in a foreign country.
fields.example: If you lose your passport, you should contact the embassy.

fields.definition: To extinguish a fire means to make it stop.
fields.example: Michael extinguished the small fire with the hose.

fields.definition: Flint is a hard stone that people used to make weapons for hunting.
fields.example: There are a lot of flint tools in the museum.

fields.definition: To harass someone means to annoy or trouble them.
fields.example: The children harassed their mother because they wanted her attention.

fields.definition: To integrate means to join, communicate and socialize.
fields.example: Governments want immigrants to integrate with the population.

fields.definition: If something is miniature, it is very small.
fields.example: The boy enjoys playing with his miniature train set in his bedroom.

fields.definition: Nutrition is the process by which people use food to stay healthy.
fields.example: It is important to pay attention to nutrition if you want to be an athlete.

fields.definition: If something happens promptly, it happens quickly or on time.
fields.example: Arrive promptly, or we won’t have time to discuss everything.

fields.definition: A technician is a person who is skilled in electronic or mechanical work.
fields.example: I need to call the technician to help me with my computer.

fields.definition: The tropics are the areas of land and sea close to the equator.
fields.example: People like to go to the tropics for vacation because it’s warm.

fields.definition: If something is beneficial, it is good for you.
fields.example: Drinking milk everyday is beneficial to your bones.

fields.definition: A birthplace is a place where a person is born or where something started.
fields.example: China is the birthplace of chopsticks.

fields.definition: The capacity of something is the amount of things that can be put in it.
fields.example: The parking lot has reached its full capacity.

fields.definition: If something is comparative, it is being judged based on something else.
fields.example: The money that John has is comparative to most other adults.

fields.definition: If something is comprehensive, it has all the details about something else.
fields.example: The teacher gave us a comprehensive review for the exam.

fields.definition: To conserve something is to protect it from being ruined or used completely.
fields.example: The group worked to conserve the beauty of Europe’s national parks.

fields.definition: If something is crucial, it is extremely important to another thing.
fields.example: Clean air is crucial to the survival of humans, plants, and animals.

fields.definition: Cumulative describes an increase by adding one after another.
fields.example: The cumulative snowfall in the area is 50 centimeters per year.

fields.definition: To deposit something is to put it into a place or another thing.
fields.example: I deposited the money into my bank account.
