fields.definition: To distribute something is to give it to a number of people.
fields.example: The teacher distributed crayons and markers to his students.

fields.definition: The equator is an imaginary line that splits the Earth into north and south.
fields.example: The equator crosses the northern part of South America.

fields.definition: Exotic describes something unusual because it is from far away.
fields.example: Rebecca tried many exotic foods on her trip to Africa.

fields.definition: If something is federal, it comes from the government of a country.
fields.example: Sometimes federal laws are different from state laws.

fields.definition: A formation is the way that something is made.
fields.example: The formation of ice happens when water freezes.

fields.definition: The frequency of something is the number of times that it happens.
fields.example: The frequency of rainstorms is very high, especially during the spring.

fields.definition: An objective is a goal or plan that someone has.
fields.example: My objective this week is to finish my homework by 7:30 every night.

fields.definition: Oxygen is a gas that all living things need to breathe.
fields.example: My aunt believes that the oxygen in the country is cleaner than in the city.

fields.definition: A rainforest is a forest that is in a place where it rains very often.
fields.example: The rainforest is home to many animals.

fields.definition: A strategy is a plan for how to do something.
fields.example: The team came up with a strategy to win the game.

fields.definition: If an area is wooded, it is covered with trees.
fields.example: Jim and Ben decided to go hiking in the wooded area by the river.

fields.definition: Avail is help. It is often used in the achievement of a goal.
fields.example: His studying was to no avail because he failed the test.

fields.definition: To expand is to become bigger in size.
fields.example: A balloon will expand as you blow air into it.

fields.definition: To define means to clearly state, show, or explain what something is.
fields.example: People define success in many different ways.

fields.definition: To dread is to be afraid of something that could, or is going to, happen.
fields.example: I dread the idea that I will not get into college.

fields.definition: If something is fundamental, it is a basic part of something.
fields.example: The fundamental rules of basketball are easy.

fields.definition: If something is horrifying, it is frightening and very unpleasant.
fields.example: There was a horrifying car accident today.

fields.definition: If someone is incredulous about something, they do not believe that it is true.
fields.example: She was incredulous that monkeys could ever drive a car.

fields.definition: To linger is to last for a long time.
fields.example: The smell of fresh cookies lingered in the bakery.

fields.definition: An organism is a living thing, especially a very small one.
fields.example: We studied the organism on the microscope.

fields.definition: To paraphrase is to make someone else’s writing or speech shorter.
fields.example: The students were asked to paraphrase the story they just heard.

fields.definition: A plague is a serious disease that quickly spreads to many people.
fields.example: A plague in Europe killed millions of people.

fields.definition: If something happens presently, it is happening right now.
fields.example: Presently, our profits are good, but by next year we can do even better.

fields.definition: If something is random, it happens without any pattern or reason.
fields.example: Young children often ask random questions.

fields.definition: A riot is a crowd that reacts to bad news by violently breaking laws.
fields.example: A riot broke out after the candidate lost the election.

fields.definition: To scribble is to write something quickly without caring about how it looks.
fields.example: I scribbled a rough diagram of our plan and gave it to him.

fields.definition: A shrine is a religious building built to honor a person, event, or god.
fields.example: He prayed at the shrine for an hour.

fields.definition: Solitude is the state of being totally alone.
fields.example: John lives a life of solitude because he doesn’t get along well with people.

fields.definition: If a contrast is stark, then the things being compared are utterly different.
fields.example: There is a stark contrast between their test scores.

fields.definition: To summon a person is to ask them to come to you.
fields.example: We summoned the doctor as soon as we noticed she was sick.

fields.definition: To worsen is to get worse.
fields.example: The weather suddenly worsened, and we had to stay inside.

fields.definition: An automobile is a car.
fields.example: The first automobiles were very different from the ones that exist today.

fields.definition: A candidate is a person who is competing to win something such as a job.
fields.example: Alice is the best candidate for the job.

fields.definition: If something is confidential, it must be kept secret.
fields.example: The information from the meeting is confidential.

fields.definition: If something is corporate, it is related to a large business.
fields.example: Tom enjoys working in the corporate world.

fields.definition: To enhance something is to make it better.
fields.example: Amy’s blue shirt really enhances the color of her eyes.

fields.definition: An era is a period of time that has something special about it.
fields.example: During the medieval era, knights wore protective armor.

fields.definition: A guideline is a rule about how to do something.
fields.example: Before they began the project, the teacher gave them some guidelines.

fields.definition: To incorporate is to add something to another thing.
fields.example: I decided to incorporate a new ingredient into my cake recipe.

fields.definition: To interact is to talk to or do something with another person.
fields.example: The kids began to interact when the adults left the room.

fields.definition: An interval is the time between two things happening.
fields.example: Tony rested for brief intervals while he worked in the yard.

fields.definition: If something is mobile, it can be moved easily.
fields.example: Mobile phones are popular because you can take them anywhere.

fields.definition: To modify something is to change it a little bit.
fields.example: I modified my outfit by adding a belt to it.

fields.definition: If two things are parallel, they are the same distance away from each other.
fields.example: There are two yellow parallel lines dividing both sides of traffic.

fields.definition: A phenomenon is something that can be seen as it is happening.
fields.example: I was amazed when I saw the phenomenon of shooting stars.

fields.definition: To pollute means to make air, water, or land dirty, unclean, or foul.
fields.example: The careless factory polluted the river with chemicals.

fields.definition: To ridicule is to make fun of something in a mean way.
fields.example: The other students ridicule Peter’s foreign accent.

fields.definition: If something is solar, it is related to the sun.
fields.example: Using solar energy is good for the environment.

fields.definition: A territory is a piece of land that belongs to a country but isn’t a state.
fields.example: Gibraltar is a territory of Great Britain.

fields.definition: A tournament is a competition, usually with many people participating.
fields.example: My dad is playing in a golf tournament tomorrow.

fields.definition: Transportation is any type of vehicle that can carry people or things.
fields.example: I don’t have a car, so my normal transportation is the train.

fields.definition: A bill is a statement of money owed for goods or a service.
fields.example: I have so many bills that I do not know how to pay for them all.

fields.definition: A boundary is the line where one area of land stops, and another begins.
fields.example: This fence shows the boundary between our yard and yours.

fields.definition: Chaos is a situation that is confusing and not ordered.
fields.example: His presentation was in chaos. I couldn’t understand what he meant.

fields.definition: If a person is consistent, they keep the same behavior or attitude.
fields.example: Sara comes in every day and is our most consistent worker.

fields.definition: A cyclone is a large storm with heavy rain and winds that spin in a circle.
fields.example: Hundreds of homes were damaged by the cyclone.

fields.definition: If someone or something is doomed, they are going to fail or be destroyed.
fields.example: Since I spent all my money, my date with Jane is doomed.

fields.definition: An heir is a person who receives money or property of someone who dies.
fields.example: The princess was the heir to the king and queen’s throne.

fields.definition: If something is martial, it is related to fighting or war.
fields.example: Karate is a martial art that began many years ago in Japan.

fields.definition: If food is organic, it is grown without adding chemicals to it.
fields.example: The organic carrots are more expensive, but they’re better for you.

fields.definition: Poultry is a bird, such as a chicken, that is used for meat and eggs.
fields.example: He raises poultry and sells their meat for extra money.

fields.definition: To scramble is to move somewhere quickly and desperately.
fields.example: The hikers scrambled down the side of the hill.

fields.definition: A sergeant is a soldier or police officer of middle rank.
fields.example: He was promoted to sergeant after a year in the army.

fields.definition: If you describe something as sheer, it is complete and very strong.
fields.example: I was impressed by her sheer dedication to jogging.

fields.definition: A stance is an attitude about an issue that someone states clearly.
fields.example: My stance is that using oil and gas is bad for the environment.

fields.definition: A telegraph is a method of sending electric messages on wires.
fields.example: In the 1900s, the telegraph was the fastest way to send a message.

fields.definition: Textile is cloth that has been woven or knitted.
fields.example: The blue textile was going to be used to make blouses.

fields.definition: A tornado is a tube-shaped formation of air that spins very quickly.
fields.example: During a tornado, the safest place to be is underground.

fields.definition: A typhoon is a large tropical storm that moves in circles.
fields.example: Thousands of people lost electricity after a typhoon hit Australia.

fields.definition: To wail is to show sadness by crying loudly.
fields.example: The baby wailed because it was hungry.

fields.definition: A wardrobe is the collection of all of a person’s clothing.
fields.example: She bought some new clothes to expand her wardrobe.
